intro: Hillia allenii, commonly known as the Allen's hillia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in well-drained environments. It is a perennial herb that produces small, oval leaves and is often found in open woodland areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Hillia allenii is considered a rare and endangered species.
